project.description: Build check on an old RHEL6.4 x86 installation. We try here to generate a bitstream, that can take a while.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#set +x ulimit -c unlimited
echo '****************************************************************************************' echo 'COPYING DATA to AFS' echo '****************************************************************************************' export HOMEDIR=`pwd` export TESTNAME=`basename $HOMEDIR` export CI_WS_DIR=/afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/CI_ws/ADKU3_IMG/
rsync -az --delete $HOMEDIR $CI_WS_DIR cd ${CI_WS_DIR}/${TESTNAME}
echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "Get PSL Simulation Environment ..." echo "****************************************************************************************" rm -rf pslse git clone https://github.com/ibm-capi/pslse pslse export PSLSE_ROOT=${CI_WS_DIR}/${TESTNAME}/pslse
echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "LSF SETUP ..." echo "****************************************************************************************" export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/home/lsfbb/prod/9.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin export LSF_SERVERDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/9.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/etc export LSF_LIBDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/9.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/lsfbb/prod/9.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib export LSF_BINDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/9.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin export LSF_SUBMITTER_OSTYPE=Linux export LSF_ENVDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/conf
echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "Vivado SETUP ..." echo "****************************************************************************************" export XILINX_ROOT=/afs/bb/proj/fpga/xilinx export XILINXD_LICENSE_FILE=2100@pokwinlic1.pok.ibm.com export VIV_VERSION="2017.4"
source $XILINX_ROOT/Vivado/${VIV_VERSION}/settings64.sh
echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "Setup SNAP Build Environment ..." echo "****************************************************************************************"
cd ${CI_WS_DIR}/${TESTNAME}/snap export PSL_DCP=/afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/cards/ADKU3/current/b_route_design.dcp
#setup snap_env.sh echo "export PSLSE_ROOT=$CI_WS_DIR/$TESTNAME/pslse" > snap_env.sh echo "export PSL_DCP=$PSL_DCP" >> snap_env.sh echo "export TIMING_LABLIMIT=\"-10\"" >> snap_env.sh
echo "using the following DCP: $(readlink -f $PSL_DCP)"
# Build the USER and FACTORY bitstreams make -s ADKU3.hdl_example.SDRAM.FACTORY.defconfig
# # The following step submits the Image Build to LSF, since it is very # very timeconsuming. # bsub -P zsort -I -M 10 -n 4 -R 'span[hosts=1]' -R 'select[type=X86_64]' make image
# Compile the MCS file from FACTORY and USER bitstreams factory_bitstream=`ls -t ./hardware/build/Images/fw_*[0-9]_FACTORY.bit | head -n1` echo "Factory bitstream=$factory_bitstream" user_bitstream=`ls -t ./hardware/build/Images/fw_*[0-9].bit | head -n1` echo "User bitstream=$user_bitstream" export FPGACARD=ADKU3 ./hardware/setup/build_mcs.tcl $factory_bitstream $user_bitstream ${factory_bitstream%.bit}.mcs
echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "COPY RESULTS" echo "****************************************************************************************" scp ./hardware/build/Images/*.bi[nt] fpga@fpga02://opt/fpga/snap/$FPGACARD/ scp ${factory_bitstream%.bit}.mcs fpga@fpga02://opt/fpga/snap/$FPGACARD/ scp ${factory_bitstream%.bit}.prm fpga@fpga02://opt/fpga/snap/$FPGACARD/
